THE ISSUANCE OF FISCAL YEAR 2020 – 2021 MOTOR VEHICLE TAX BILLS HAS BEEN DELAYED.

Due to issues associated with the Covid-19 pandemic, the Town is awaiting the passage of the State Budget and final determination on the current motor vehicle tax phase-out program.

To avoid the cost of issuing a supplemental bill the Town of North Kingstown elected to delay the issuance of motor vehicle tax bills.

Once the State Budget is passed and there is clarity on this matter, bills will be printed and mailed. As a result, the due date of MOTOR VEHICLE taxes will be adjusted.

By doing it in this manner, you can minimize the impacts of discolored water inside your home. It may take some time for the distribution system piping in the streets to clear up, but they will eventually clear. Again thank you for your patience and our apologies for the inconvenience.

The Tuesday morning 18 hole women's golf league is welcoming new members this season . It's start in April if the weather cooperates. Or you can join anytime during the season. Tee times start at 9:00am for April and then 8:00 in May with a shotgun format. We play until the end of September officially but some ladies play until the weather permits.
The great thing about this group is you sign up a week in advance for your tee time. If you cannot play you don't sign up. The staff is very helpful if you need to call for your tee time or cancel.
Cost to join the group is a nominal $50 which includes monthly tournaments and end of season banquet.
If you have have any questions feel free to get in touch with Judi Cleaveland at 401-932-0080 or jacleave@aol.com

WATER MAIN BREAK -
There has been an emergency water main break on Post Road in vicinity of Intrepid Drive. Water service will be impacted from the intersection of West Main Street and Post Road north to the intersection of Post Road and Richard Smith Drive. This will include the Juniper Drive, Intrepid Drive, and Hopedale Drive neighborhoods. The Water Dept will make every effort to further isolate the impacted area so as to minimize disruption of water service. We will stay on site until all service is restored. Keep in mind that after water service restoration, cloudy or discolored water may be experienced for a short time. Run your faucets until the water clears up. Code Red notification to all registered has been issued.

If you have not received your CODE RED notification, please visit the website to confirm your information and if using cell phone , please note your carrier.

EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

Applications are now being accepted in Office of Town Manager, Municipal Offices,
100 Fairway Drive, North Kingstown, RI 02852 for following position:

ASSISTANT ANIMAL WARDEN Public Safety Department
North Kingstown Animal Shelter Division of Police

Part time employment, 24 hour work week, Saturday, Sunday and one weekday.

Assist Animal Warden in enforcing animal control Town ordinances; handle complaints from public; clean and feed animals at the Animal Shelter; removal of dead animals from Town streets; handle possible rabid wildlife. General maintenance of animal vehicles and facilities to include sewer trap. Appropriate record keeping and timely filing of official reports.

Qualifications: High School diploma or GED. Experience dealing with domestic animals and performing custodial or manual work. Ability to interact effectively with public and volunteers. Valid RI driver’s license.

Salary: $18.78/hour

Application period closes September 5, 2019
EOE
